definition: to discredit/to defame/to smear sb's name/to bring shame upon (oneself or one's family etc)/to blacken (e.g. commando's face for camouflage)/to black out or obliterate (e.g. censored words)
to plaster/to go around/to skirt
to smear/to wipe/to erase/classifier for wisps of cloud, light-beams etc
to wipe
abbr. for Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1]
black/dark/sinister/secret/shady/illegal/to hide (sth) away/to vilify/(loanword) to hack (computing)
to bring shame to/to smear/to disgrace
see 烏漆墨黑|乌漆墨黑[wu1 qi1 mo4 hei1]

sentences.english: It uses people's instinct and ignorant of science to try to blemish Soya Bean Salad Oil.
sentences.chinese: 是在利用人們的直覺和世俗感覺來抹黑大豆色拉油。

sentences.english: Just worked to reporter station, I am to have some of feeling of two one bring shame on really.
sentences.chinese: 剛到記者站工作，我是真有些兩眼一抹黑的感覺。

sentences.english: We're not gonna let him bring shame on our team.
sentences.chinese: 我們絕不會讓他給我們隊臉上抹黑。

sentences.english: We are not going to let them bring shame on our country.
sentences.chinese: 我們不許可他們給我們國家臉上抹黑。

sentences.english: By stigmatizing the values movement, the Left hopes to avoid the issues in debate.
sentences.chinese: 被抹黑的價值運動，希望離開，以避免問題的辯論。

sentences.english: Since then, the Handan area, it left a groom to marry the daughter-in-law to discredit custom face.
sentences.chinese: 自此，邯鄲一帶，便留下了新郎娶媳婦抹黑臉的風俗。

sentences.english: The western world was indeed black with homicidal monomania .
sentences.chinese: 西方世界的確被殺人狂抹黑了。

sentences.english: Their attempt to defame China will get nowhere.
sentences.chinese: 這些人利用謠言抹黑中國的企圖決不會得逞。

sentences.english: All he's trying to do is to throw mud at my name.
sentences.chinese: 他所作的一切都是爲了往我的名字上抹黑。

sentences.english: Itwas used by the government to discredit totalitarianism in general.
sentences.chinese: 這是政府慣用的手法來抹黑極權主義。

sentences.english: We are not going to let him bring shame on our collective.
sentences.chinese: 不許他給我們集體臉上抹黑。

sentences.english: Outside the window the sky is gray, and is discrediting these people.
sentences.chinese: 窗外的天空是灰的，是被這些人抹黑的。

sentences.english: Debilitate or sling mud at him, and you win!
sentences.chinese: 誹謗抹黑他，然後你贏了。

sentences.english: Of course, the Palins and Palin supporters would like to discredit him.
sentences.chinese: 當然，佩林一家和佩林的支持者都想抹黑他。

sentences.english: Third, they would attack their adversaries, smear them and threaten to drag them down with them.
sentences.chinese: 第三步則是反咬對手，抹黑大家，威脅一起同歸於盡。

definition: to start a rumor
(lit.) to splash dirty water/(fig.) to throw mud at/to smear (sb)
to vilify/to slander/vilification
variant of 污衊|污蔑[wu1 mie4]
to defame/to libel/to defile/to smear/to vilify
to slander/to smear/to vilify
malicious libel/slander
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to make up/to fabricate
to start rumours and create trouble
to slander/to libel
deliberate/premeditated/malice
to have an ulterior motive (idiom)
to confuse right and wrong (idiom)
lit. to invert black and white (idiom); to distort the truth deliberately/to misrepresent the facts/to invert right and wrong
to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
